title: Test level
info:
Headings elements can be defined by tags

to

, in the order of importance. With each heading, the content will reduce is size. Tags will start and end like so:

content goes here

. The tags must start and end with the same type, and end with a slash (/). Though each heading has default settings, they can be overwritten using with the style attribute using the CSS properties. An example of this would be

content goes here

. The CSS attribute must be specified (in this case, fontsize), followed by a colon and the desired value for said CSS attribute. Ensure that it's also wrapped in quotation marks.

mcQuestions.question: What is the correct way to start and end a heading tag?
mcQuestions.explanation: The heading tag must start and end with the same heading type (h1) and must end with a slash (/)

answers.text: The first usable prototype of the internet came in the late 1960s

<h1>
 HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language
<h1>

mcQuestions.question: What is the correct order for headings?
mcQuestions.explanation: The heading order must go from 1-6. They must go in order from least to greatest.

mcQuestions.question: What is the correct way to style a heading tag?
mcQuestions.explanation: The CSS atribute must be wrapped in quotation marks. The attribute and desired value must be seperated by a colon.
